title: [Large-scale] Mathematics Instruction Improvement Program Applying the UDL Framework: Optimization of Computation, Formula, and Graph Utilization

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic pedagogical methods and UDL (Universal Design for Learning) concepts, ability to interpret high school-level mathematical formulas and graphs
context.additional_context: A systematic training course for pre-service and in-service teachers to apply UDL principles in mathematics instruction. Focuses on multiple representation strategies for core math concepts (calculation problems, geometric modeling, statistical data visualization) to address diversified learner needs.

learning_goals: Participants apply UDLâ€™s 3 principles (engagement, representation, action/expression) to design mathematics lessons, diversifying equation-solving and graph analysis activities.
Participants analyze UDL-based lesson scenarios in simulation/VR environments and propose improvements for multiple representations of probability and statistics data.
Participants revise their mathematics instructional materials according to UDL standards and submit project outcomes including diverse proof methods for problem-solving processes.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
